security: Disclosing that the NSA was monitoring communications between Romania and Turkey following Kennedy's assassination could reveal intelligence-gathering capabilities and sources.
summary: An NSA document reports on the Romanian Premier's visit to Belgrade and the lack of special measures taken in Bucharest following President Kennedy's assassination.
summary_one_paragraph: This TOP SECRET UMBRA document from the NSA, dated November 25, 1963, summarizes a Turkish intelligence report indicating that Romanian Premier Gheorghiu-Dej and other officials visited Belgrade to sign the Ada-Kaleh dam agreement, noting that Tito gave them a special welcome. The report also mentions that no extraordinary measures were implemented in Bucharest following the death of President Kennedy, with the exception of summoning a few generals.
title: ROMANAIN PREMIER AND PARTY IN BELGRADE: NO SPECIAL ME [R]
